meta.name: description
meta.content: Welcome to Newton Falls Exempted Village Schools. Newton Falls, Ohio 44444. Please browse our website for everything related to the school district. The Newton Falls Community is one of the best communities and schools in Northeast Ohio to raise your family and develop friendships.

br.a: View this day in history video.

tr.td: April 30th Board of Education Meeting Pursuant to Senate Bill 197, that was passed by the Ohio legislature and signed by Governor DeWine, boards of education are permitted to conduct board meetings electronically. As a result, the Newton Falls Exempted Village School District Board of Education will conduct its regular meeting of the Board on April 30, 2020 at 6 p.m. electronically. It is anticipated that the Board of Education will be waiving public participation for the upcoming meeting. The meeting will be held electronically and can be accessed at the following website via a link that will be posted: http://www.newton-falls.k12.oh.us/

td.p: Rhonda Knoske, the district's school nurse, will be providing information pertaining to the COVID-19 virus. Please view the following web page for more information.

You can now sign-up for the district email list by clicking the link below. Information will be sent to your inbox directly when it is distributed. Please be sure to add enews@nfschools.org to your email contacts so the email is not sent to your spam folder.

h2.a: Locker Clean Out and Assignment Drop Off Grades 6-12

div.div: On Monday, May 4 (Seniors), Tuesday, May 5th and again on Tuesday May 12, we will be collecting remaining assignments and allowing students to come in and clean their lockers under the following strict guidelines... Please click the link below for details. For more information: http://www.newton-falls.k12.oh.us/images/260/ProcedureForLockerClean-6-12.pdf

h2.a: Food Pickup Scheduled - Tuesday, April 28 - 3 pm - 6 pm

div.div: We will again be distributing food from the high school front entrance on Tuesday, April 28 from 3pm - 6pm for families in our community, that are in need of food. We are asking that you put your address on a big piece of paper, and hold it up to your window so we can mark it off of our list. Please do this each week. We have also been instructed to place the food in your trunk. This is considered the safest protocol! Thank you and God Bless!

7-12 Track and Field Parents:
We are expecting our track gear, as well as the boxes of frozen cookie dough to be delivered very soon. We are making arrangements to get you the gear and the frozen cookie dough at one or more of the Tuesday School Packet Food Distribution days at the High School. Stay tuned for updated information.
7-12 Track parents and team: join Band app (phone or computer) for team communication https://band.us/n/adaa34S9G1L0z
/>

Kindergarten screening previously scheduled for April 22nd and 24th has been postponed at this time.
We will reschedule when permissible.

Parents and Students:
Unfortunately, the Coronavirus has caused our Sixth Grade trip to Washington D.C. on May 6-8, 2020, to be postponed until possibly October or November of 2020. I have been working with our administrators and the travel company at this point to ensure the students do not lose out on this wonderful opportunity. We will have more information for you as soon as possible.
Thank you and stay safe, Peggy Giuliano
Due to the COVID-19 Issues, the Newton Falls Board of Education meeting for tomorrow, April 16, has been postponed. We will have more information later this month about rescheduling of this meeting.

This is a reminder that tomorrow Tuesday April 7 from 3-7, we will be distributing food boxes as we have been doing in the previous weeks at the high school commons for any families of K-12 students in need of supplies. We will also be distributing assignment packets and collecting completed work at the HS building for students in grades 6-12.
For K-5 students, please make sure you go to the ES/MS building to turn in any assignments.
Kindergarten, first and second grade will not be distributing new materials this week for pick up as they provided two weeks of work last week. If you did not pick up materials last week, they are still available on Tuesday from 3-7 at the ES/MS building. All work can be turned in through Dojo, teacher email or turned in on Tuesday.
3rd through 5th grade students who can not access Google classroom will need to pick up packets for the upcoming week and turn in completed work on Tuesday, April 7th at the ES/MS building from 3-7. We do encourage everyone to turn in as much work as possible through Google classroom or emailing their teacher directly.
If you are turning in student work, please make sure that the student name is on every assignment. Please stay tuned to the district website www.nfschools.org for assignment information.
Families in need of chromebooks that did not pick them up or couldn't reserve one last week can now pick up a device on Tuesday, April 7 from 3-7 PM at both the HS and the ES/MS. If possible, please complete the form found on the district website.
While we encourage public use of our track as long as social distancing is practiced, individuals must refrain from assembling in large groups on the property.
As always, we hope you stay safe and healthy. Thank you and have a great evening.

Things are a little different this year… Normally, representatives from the Music & Arts music store in Canfield would come to our school and let the fourth grade students make a sound on all of the instruments possible to play in the Fifth Grade Band: flute, clarinet, saxophone, trumpet, trombone, and percussion. Sadly, we cannot do that this year.
For more information: http://www.newton-falls.k12.oh.us/images/174/2020NewtonFallsMiddleSchoolBandSignUp.pdf

Dear kindergarten families,
The kindergarten teachers have sent you a way to create a login for your child(ren) on Class Dojo. This way they can communicate with us on Class Dojo. Your child(ren) can take a picture of their completed work and upload it to us. This way work is not lost as well. You also have the option to email us pictures of their work. You will have the option to turn these papers into the school if you choose. We are giving you the option on here so you do not have to leave your home. As well as we are limiting things everyone is touching during this time.
Thank you for your understanding.
Miss Blank email blankj@nfschools.org
Mrs.Koehrsen email koehrsenr@nfschools.org
Mrs. Fening email feningn@nfschools.org
Mrs. Colaluca email colalucac@nfschools.org

Please complete the information below regarding your intention to register a child for Kindergarten next year. Once you have completed the form, we will mail you a packet to complete with additional information on when and how to turn in the packet. This is for parents who have not already registered. For more information: https://bit.ly/2JTDPsQ

We've received some emails with questions regarding the due dates for assignments. The assignments that were distributed on 3/16 will be due next week on Tuesday, April 7th. If students have not received those initial assignments, they will be available today for pick up from 3-7 PM. Completed assignments may be turned in at this time but are not due until April 7th.
Students wishing to obtain new packets for the second round of assignments can retrieve those virtually or today in paper form at the respective school buildings from 3-7 PM. These packets will also be available next Tuesday as well for those who can't retrieve them today. These will not be due until April 14th.
Please look at the table as we've adjusted it for clarity. If you have any questions about assignments or due dates, please email rankinr@nfschools.org (HS/JH) or wittl@nfschools.org (ES/MS). We apologize for any confusion and appreciate your patience!
The following is a listing of available community resources. For more information: http://www.newton-falls.k12.oh.us/images/174/communityResources.pdf

*THIS FORM IS FOR ANY FAMILY THAT IS IN NEED OF A TECHNOLOGY DEVICE FOR YOUR CHILD(REN) TO ACCESS INSTRUCTIONAL MATERIALS DURING THE EXTENDED SCHOOL CLOSURE. PLEASE NOTE, THIS CHROMEBOOK DOES NOT COME WITH INTERNET; YOU MUST BE ABLE TO ACCESS INTERNET IN ORDER FOR THIS DEVICE TO WORK. ** Chromebooks will be distributed as 1 per household. For more information: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScF7od0QtAREzGn3pmWFjJEEoM6-6vKUPK5RuW0Yw_jKrM_yg/viewform?usp=sf_link

h2.a: How to Support Your Child’s Health and Well-Being During Ohio’s Ordered School-Building Closure

div.div: The Ohio Department of Education has created some resources to help support your child's Social and Emotional health. If you have any questions regarding this link or if there are any other needs that you may have please reach out to Miss Brown at brownk@nfschools.org or Mrs Fischer at fischerj@nfschools.org. We pray that everyone is staying safe and healthy and we miss all of you! For more information: http://education.ohio.gov/Topics/Student-Supports/Coronavirus/Supporting-Children’s-Social-Emotional-and-Behavi

These short social-emotional lessons will provide a positive social-emotional opportunity for your child's growth and development. Through these short daily lessons your child will learn self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship skills and responsible decision making. This strong and healthy foundation will lead to future academic success.
You can reach by email at brownk@nfschools.org if you have any questions during this unprecedented time.
K-2: https://bit.ly/34lsIlO
3-5: https://bit.ly/34lsIlO

h2.a: New Music Website for K-5 Students

div.div: Mrs. Criazzo has created a new website for K-5 music students. You can check that out at: http://nfmusiccriazzo.weebly.com/

Dear Students and Parents of the Newton Falls Exempted Village School District:
First and foremost, our staff hopes that everyone is keeping safe and practicing the necessary habits to slow the spread of the coronavirus.
Secondly, the Newton Falls Classroom Teachers want all of our students to know that we are concerned about you and that we will remain available to assist you with your education, and with anything else that you may need.
Your teachers are available through a variety of methods such as: email, Class Dojo, Remind, Google Classroom, and personal phone calls. Continue to use the methods that your teachers have already discussed with you, and please check them daily. If you are unsure of what to do, or have questions, contact your individual teachers through their email.
Remember, we are all in this together. We hope to see all of you sometime soon!
The Newton Falls Classroom Teachers.

Message from Superintendent Paul Woodard.
School will be cancelled for students from Monday, March 16 though Friday, April 3 per the Governors orders. Sporting events, extra curricular activities, and all practices are also cancelled until further notice.
Class assignments will be posted on the schools website (nfschools.org) for students to access. We will also have paper copies available on Monday, March 16 from 8:30am to 2:30pm for students to pick up at the schools if they do not have Internet access. The building will also be open at this time for students to get materials from their lockers.
We will update you as information becomes available. Stay safe, stay healthy, check on your neighbors, and God Bless all of us, through this difficult time!

At Newton Falls Schools, we want to keep our students healthy and ready to learn. In light of recent concerns about coronavirus and seasonal flu, we want to provide you with guidelines to help protect our school and community.
• Please keep students at home when they are ill. Symptoms to keep children at home for include fever of 100° or higher, excessive coughing, sore throat with fever, vomiting, diarrhea, and redness/irritation of the eye.
• Students must be free of fever (less than 100°) for 24 hours without fever-reducing medication such as Tylenol or ibuprofen before returning to school. Students with vomiting or diarrhea should remain at home until 24 hours has passed since the last episode of vomiting or diarrhea.
• Make sure to report your child off school each day. It is very helpful that you make us aware of your child’s symptoms such as fever, cough, vomiting, diarrhea, etc. This information helps us identify specific health concerns and populations that are affected.
• Practice frequent, thorough hand washing. Hands should be washed for at least 20 seconds with soap and water and dried on a clean towel or allowed to air dry. Please practice hand washing with your children. Teaching young children to sing Happy Birthday twice while they are washing their hands can be a good way to help them measure the 20 seconds.
• Avoid touching your face, eyes, nose or mouth.
• Cover coughs and sneezes with a tissue or your sleeve. Discard used tissues in the garbage immediately and wash your hands.
• Keep older family members or those with chronic illnesses such as lung or heart disease, cancer or diabetes away from members of the household who are ill.
• Get plenty of rest and eat a well-balanced diet to keep your immune system in optimal shape.
Rest assured we are taking precautionary measures at school to disinfect surfaces, door handles, and other areas on a more frequent basis. We will also do a thorough cleaning during the week of spring break.
Thank you all for helping to keep our students healthy!

tr.td:
Superintendent's Newsletter On Tuesday, March 17th, the Newton Falls Exempted Village Schools will have two renewal levies on the ballot. These are renewal levies, not new levies. These will not increase your taxes and the school district relies heavily on them. Please vote on Tuesday, March 17th and thank you for your support!
To read the newsletter, click here.

Athletic Booster Club Brick Fundraiser The Newton Falls Athletic Booster Club is running a Brick Fundraiser. A walkway will be built leading up to the track that will be built with bricks with messages on them from the community. You can order a brick with three lines of text for $85 or six lines of text for $200. Order forms are available in all building offices or go to view the order form you can print, click here.

In Case Of Emergency In case of emergencies such as school closings, bus delays or upcoming events, the district will use its computerized telephone notification system to inform parents. It is extremely important that parents verify their emergency telephone numbers with each building secretary. If you have changed telephone numbers or are now using only a cell phone contact to be reached please update your information with the building secretary.
